Docs.summary: Exposes the public members of the class to unmanaged code.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This interface is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code and should not be called from managed code.
This interface preserves the vtable order of the <xref:System.Reflection.MemberInfo?displayProperty=fullName> class members that can be accessed by unmanaged COM objects.

MemberSignature.Value: public Type DeclaringType { get; }
.property instance class System.Type DeclaringType

Docs.summary: Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the property.
Docs.value: The object for the class that declares this member.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code and should not be called from managed code.
The <xref:System.Reflection.MemberInfo.DeclaringType%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property gets the class that declares this member.

The <xref:System.Object.Equals%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method determines whether the specified <xref:System.Object> is equal to the current <xref:System.Object>.

The <xref:System.Reflection.MemberInfo.GetCustomAttributes%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method returns an array containing all the custom attributes.

to search this member's inheritance chain to find the attributes; otherwise, .

The <xref:System.Reflection.Assembly.GetCustomAttributes%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method returns an array of custom attributes identified by <xref:System.Type>.

MemberSignature.Value: public int GetHashCode ();
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance int32 GetHashCode() cil managed

Docs.summary: Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the method.
Docs.returns: The hash code for the current instance.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code and should not be called from managed code.
The <xref:System.Object.GetHashCode%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method serves as a hash function for a particular type. <xref:System.Object.GetHashCode%2A> is suitable for use in hashing algorithms and data structures such as a hash table.

Docs.param: Reserved for future use. Must be IID_NULL.
An array of names to be mapped.
The count of the names to be mapped.
The locale context in which to interpret the names.
An array allocated by the caller that receives the identifiers corresponding to the names.
Docs.summary: Maps a set of names to a corresponding set of dispatch identifiers.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code and should not be called from managed code. For more information about `IDispatch::GetIDsOfNames`, see the MSDN Library.

Reserved for future use. Must be IID_NULL.
The locale context in which to interpret arguments.
Flags describing the context of the call.
A pointer to a structure containing an array of arguments, an array of argument DISPIDs for named arguments, and counts for the number of elements in the arrays.
A pointer to the location where the result will be stored.
A pointer to a structure that contains exception information.
The index of the first argument that has an error.
